attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As the Glasgow Evening Times on Tuesday revealed Glasgow City Council is planning to do away with 80 school crossing patrols. 

This is a bad idea in a time when road safety accidents - including child fatalities - are up according to official figures.

(Figures published in June 2007 show that 314 people died on Scotland's roads in 2006, a 10 per cent rise from 2005, including 14 more child fatalities.)

The council must reverse this decision and realise that there is no electronic substitute for a person standing there watching out for the children.
